structure.unit: ARTICLE IV. DUTIES OF PUBLIC UTILITIES

law.catch_line: Schedule of existing rates to be filed.

text.section: Within thirty (30) days after the effective date of this chapter each public utility shall file with the Board a preliminary schedule showing all rates, classifications and charges for service of every kind furnished by it, and all rules and regulations in force and effect relating thereto. Thereafter, upon notice from the Board current schedules shall be submitted, in lieu of the preliminary schedules previously filed, and maintained on file with the Board on such forms and under such rules and regulations as the Board may prescribe. Provided, however, the provisions of this section shall not be applicable to charges for contributions in aid of construction, refundable or nonrefundable agreements or other advances.
